meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: Political revolutionaries turn the world upside down. Scientific ones more often turn it inside out. And that, almost literally, is happening to the idea of what, biologically speaking, a human being is.

div.a: The Prisoner's Dilemma Has Been Solved

div.div: The discovery of a winning strategy for Prisoner's Dilemma is forcing game theorists to rethink their discipline. Their conclusion? Winning isn't everything.
The glass layered on the front of your phone is a lot of things: thin, flexible, transparent. But the only two things that matter when you drop it are its hardness and its strength.
Oh look, it's just a bunch of real samurai, chilling out with their katanas in front of the Sphinx. No big deal.

div.a: Videogame Companies As Your Real-Life Friends

div.div: Sony: Always has to fix something whenever you want to do anything. Hard to trust him after he let your credit card get stolen a few years ago. At least he doesn't make you pay for anything.

li.div: These are all pretty great, but the illustration for Blizzard is PRICELESS. dorkly.com/comic/42862/vid...

div.a: What Makes A State Fat Or Thin?

div.div: Does geography play a bigger role in the body composition of Americans... and can it be overcome?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Nv4Bag&via=Digg&text=What Makes A State Fat Or Thin?

div.a: New Videos Of Curiosity's Descent And Touchdown On Mars

div.div: Some amazing videos are still coming out from NASA about the Mars Curiosity rover’s descent to the planet’s surface. This one is blink-and-you’ll-miss-it-but-still-totally-freaking-cool: the heat shield slamming into the surface of Mars and blurting out a cloud of dust.

li.div: *Two* videos of the descent to Mars: the rover's touchdown (now in HD!) & the heat shield slamming to the surface! http://t.co/H5zsJLFI

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NRkwuk&via=Digg&text=New Videos Of Curiosity's Descent And Touchdown On Mars

div.div: Pieces of Amelia Earhart's plane might have been located in the depths of the waters off Nikumaroro island in the southwestern Pacific republic of Kiribati, according to a preliminary review of high-definition video.
A new book imagines a world where technology takes "intercourse out of the reproductive equation."

li.div: Between this and the promise of catastrophic climate change, who even wants to think about normal reproduction? guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyl... Ugh.

div.a: A Rare Look Inside Facebook's Oregon Data Center

div.div: When the temperature creeps above 90 degrees in this rural community, it’s the perfect time to see why Facebook decided to build its first data center here.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NtzFTr&via=Digg&text=A Rare Look Inside Facebook's Oregon Data Center

div.a: Do We Have A Moral Obligation To Genetically Engineer 'Ethical' Babies?

div.div: Professor Julian Savulescu says that creating so-called designer babies could be considered a "moral obligation" as it makes them grow up into "ethically better children".

li.div: Would you use genetic engineering to prevent your offspring from having a chance of being a psychopath? Why not? telegraph.co.uk/science/sc...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ns3QyS&via=Digg&text=Do We Have A Moral Obligation To Genetically Engineer 'Ethical' Babies?

div.a: Close-Up Photos Of Smaller iPhone Dock Connector

div.div: Repair firm iResq has posted some photos of what it’s calling the dock connector for the iPad mini and next-generation iPhone.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q8HexD&via=Digg&text=Close-Up Photos Of Smaller iPhone Dock Connector

div.a: Meet The 'Face-Kini,' The Latest Craze To Hit China's Beaches

div.div: At least the snuggie doesn't make you look like a serial killer.

li.div: This is SO CREEPY! RT @aboylanpgh: this has to be the funniest thing I have seen in a very long time dailymail.co.uk/news/artic...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NJqAXx&via=Digg&text=Meet The 'Face-Kini,' The Latest Craze To Hit China's Beaches

div.a: This 'Thrilling Image' Shows The Martian Hills Where The Curiosity Rover Is Going

div.div: It's been a few days since the Curiosity rover sent back a stunning image of the Martian landscape. We were getting impatient, actually. But no longer!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NMIrOY&via=Digg&text=This 'Thrilling Image' Shows The Martian Hills Where The Curiosity Rover Is Going

div.a: What A Mathematician Sees When He Goes To The Beach

div.div: "Like everyone else I know, when I go to the beach I think mathematics. Archimedes, my favorite mathematician, did too—his perhaps best-known work is the “Sand Reckoner,” wherein he counts the grains of sand it would take to fill the universe."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/N453wi&via=Digg&text=What A Mathematician Sees When He Goes To The Beach
